metadata.synopsis: The trial of the Murder Tribunal culminates in the Baptism of Blood, in the abattoir. The Tribunal will have either abducted Valeria, the Hollyphant detective, and chained her up here in order to be sacrificed, or she is already dead and you will just need to bathe in her blood.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Go to the Murder Tribunal (goto -1284 1 504) (near S_LOW_MurderTribunal_Sarevok_ae9f784a-ea64-4297-95a7-8377e85231b6)- If you want to do the trial, check LOW_MurderTribunal_Sarevok_Trial for further instructions.- If you want to skip ahead, use ReCon command "oe MT_Baptism" or "MT_Baptism_Dead" (for Valeria to have already been killed).

9.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
9.text: Go, berserker. Do as you do best - but this time in the name of Murder.
9.context: InternalNodeContext: Valeria present, but not yet killed by player in gameplay

26.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
26.text: Stumble on, Rasheman wanderer... murder well in His name.
26.context: InternalNodeContext: Valeria present, but not yet killed by player in gameplay

28.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
28.text: Slaughter deeply, aspirant, then bathe in the font of blood. The Murder Lord awaits your offering.
28.context: InternalNodeContext: Valeria present, but not yet killed by player in gameplay

41.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
41.text: Walk in blood, Unholy Assassin. It is Lord Bhaal's will.
41.context: NodeContext: Pitched low to player alone - we are playing the role of Bhaal's faithful as an act, we can't get lost in it

61.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
61.text: Do not keep your Father waiting. Slaughter first, then cleanse yourself in blood.
61.context: NodeContext: Pitched low to player alone - we are playing the role of Bhaal's faithful as an act, we can't get lost in it

64.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
64.text: Why do you wait, child of Murder? Bathe now in the font of blood and receive your Father's blessing.
64.context: NodeContext: Pitched low to player alone - we are playing the role of Bhaal's faithful as an act, we can't get lost in it

69.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
69.text: You wear our Lord's will well. Go forth and render murder in his name.
69.context: NodeContext: Pitched low to player alone - we are playing the role of Bhaal's faithful as an act, we can't get lost in it

76.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
76.text: Come, child of Bhaal. Offer thanks unto your father for your birth, and in so doing, be reborn anew.
76.context: NodeContext: Pitched low to player alone - we are playing the role of Bhaal's faithful as an act, we can't get lost in it

79.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
79.text: Slaughter this celestial being. Spill its blood into the void and through eradication of its goodness, be exalted.

78.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
78.text: You stand now on the cusp of the Dread Lord's favour.
78.context: NodeContext: Pitched low to player alone - we are playing the role of Bhaal's faithful as an act, we can't get lost in it

260.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
260.text: You have proven capable of killing those known to you, but true devotion is the killing of an innocent. One who never had reason to wrong you.
260.context: NodeContext: Pitched low to player alone - we are playing the role of Bhaal's faithful as an act, we can't get lost in it

138.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
138.text: One who dies for no other reason than the sanctity of slaughter.

184.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
184.text: Kill this celestial being, make violence of its goodness, and you will be reborn - an Unholy Assassin of Bhaal.

150.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
150.text: One killing secures your rebirth as an Unholy Assassin of Bhaal - the slaughter of a celestial being.
150.context: NodeContext: Pitched low to player alone - we are playing the role of Bhaal's faithful as an act, we can't get lost in it

73.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
73.text: Make violence of its goodness. Spill its blood, and bathe in Bhaal's eternal rapture.
73.context: NodeContext: Pitched low to player alone - we are playing the role of Bhaal's faithful as an act, we can't get lost in it

218.speaker: Valeria
218.text: Oi, I know you! Do not listen to this ancient fuck. Free me at once.
218.context: NodeContext: Pitched low to player alone - we are playing the role of Bhaal's faithful as an act, we can't get lost in it

8.speaker: Valeria
8.text: Civilian, do not listen to this ancient fuck. Free me at once.
8.context: NodeContext: Pitched low to player alone - we are playing the role of Bhaal's faithful as an act, we can't get lost in it

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Remember. We are here to find our way into Bhaal's Temple. Not to enter his service in truth.
57.context: NodeContext: Pitched low to player alone - we are playing the role of Bhaal's faithful as an act, we can't get lost in it

39.speaker: Jaheira
39.text: Remember. We are here to find our way into Bhaal's Temple. Not to enter his service in truth.
39.context: NodeContext: Pitched low to player alone - we are playing the role of Bhaal's faithful as an act, we can't get lost in it

231.speaker: Player
231.text: It shall play a symphony of screams with its trumpet!

251.speaker: Player
251.text: It shall play a symphony of screams with its trumpet!

250.speaker: Player
250.text: To strangle it with its own trunk! Yes... Yes!

55.speaker: Player
55.text: It will make a fine pair of ivory daggers.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I will sacrifice the creature to Bhaal.

271.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
271.text: Spare no violence for the Dread Lord's grace. And savour every moment of the creature's slaughter.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Blood will be spilt, Sarevok. I will slaughter you.

54.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
54.text: Feisty little creature. If you hold it down, I will slice off its trunk.
54.context: NodeContext: Surprised. The sacrifice is a hollyphant, a small, cute talking elephant with wings

142.speaker: Karlach
142.text: This is grim. If we can slip this without murdering a hollyphant, I'll be very glad.
142.context: NodeContext: Surprised. The sacrifice is a hollyphant, a small, cute talking elephant with wings

188.speaker: Lae'zel
188.text: Chk. Would you be so cowardly as to do the bidding of this turgid dread-lord?
188.context: NodeContext: Surprised. The sacrifice is a hollyphant, a small, cute talking elephant with wings

192.speaker: Lae'zel
192.text: Chk. Any sacrifice we make must be for my venerable queen, not this turgid dread-lord.
192.context: NodeContext: Surprised. The sacrifice is a hollyphant, a small, cute talking elephant with wings

200.speaker: Wyll
200.text: Outrageous. If Bhaal demands blood, you cannot, you must not, be the one to spill it for him.
200.context: NodeContext: Surprised. The sacrifice is a hollyphant, a small, cute talking elephant with wings

234.speaker: Shadowheart
234.text: This is Bhaal's sacrifice...? Wouldn't have been my first guess. Or my tenth.
234.context: NodeContext: Surprised. The sacrifice is a hollyphant, a small, cute talking elephant with wings

263.speaker: Gale
263.text: I never credited Bhaal with a sense of humour. This is some sick joke of his - let's not be part of it.
263.context: NodeContext: Pitched low, urgent - Minsc doesn't want to sacrifice the hollyphant, he wants to kill Sarevok instead

264.speaker: Astarion
264.text: This is the grand sacrifice demanded by Bhaal? This?
264.context: NodeContext: Pitched low, urgent - Minsc doesn't want to sacrifice the hollyphant, he wants to kill Sarevok instead

265.speaker: Minsc
265.text: This leathered balloon is bound. Helpless. If there must be blood spilled on this floor, Boo has some better ideas of who it should belong to.
265.context: NodeContext: Pitched low, urgent - Minsc doesn't want to sacrifice the hollyphant, he wants to kill Sarevok instead

270.speaker: Halsin
270.text: This is the sacrifice that Bhaal demands? I had expected something more... auspicious, perhaps.
270.context: NodeContext: Surprised. The sacrifice is a hollyphant, a small, cute talking elephant with wings

89.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
89.context: InternalNodeContext: Valeria not present at all - player killed her already prior to Murder Tribunal.

177.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
177.text: I failed once to kill my kin. Now, at last may I offer family blood to the Lord.

1.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
1.text: You will make a most beautiful offering to the Lord of Murder.

105.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
105.text: You slaughtered well. Your worth is proven. Enter now the font of blood and be reborn.
105.context: InternalNodeContext: Valeria not present at all - player killed her already prior to Murder Tribunal.

123.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
123.text: Take pleasure in your slaughters, Harper, and relish your unholy acts of murder.
123.context: CinematicNodeContext: We see the player walk into the pool of blood, submerging themselves

131.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
131.text: Behold Father Bhaal! Your lost child, bathed anew. Arise, Unholy Assassin!
131.context: CinematicNodeContext: We see the player walk into the pool of blood, submerging themselves

284.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
284.text: HIS MOST UNHOLY WILL BE DONE.
284.context: CinematicNodeContext: We see a shot of the player emerging from the blood, it cascades down from their face. We see them open their eyes: pitch black. They blink once, and their eyes are normal again.

114.text: Yes, Boo - Sarevok does speak like one who has not tasted Minsc's boot on his brow before. You will recall we killed you once before, Bhaalspawn.
114.context: CinematicNodeContext: We see a shot of the player emerging from the blood, it cascades down from their face. We see them open their eyes: pitch black. They blink once, and their eyes are normal again.

51.text: Yes, Boo - Sarevok does speak like one who has not tasted Minsc's boot on his brow before. You will recall we killed you once before, Bhaalspawn.
51.context: NodeContext: Jeering - she's meeting an old enemy from the previous games

134.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
134.text: Yes, Boo - Sarevok does speak like one who has not tasted Minsc's boot on his brow before. You will recall we killed you once before, Bhaalspawn.

247.speaker: Player
247.text: Yes, Boo - Sarevok does speak like one who has not tasted Minsc's boot on his brow before. You will recall we killed you once before, Bhaalspawn.

120.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
120.text: And yet I returned to my Father's service, and brought you with me, Rasheman wanderer. For in your baptism are we united under Bhaal.

283.speaker: Player
283.text: Sarevok, Bhaal's least favourite son. Still tied to daddy's apron-strings?
283.context: NodeContext: Jeering - she's meeting an old enemy from the previous games

77.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
77.text: No more than you are, Harper. For you have been reborn. And in our service are we united, Unholy Assassin.

206.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
206.text: Another walks in Bhaal's bloody footsteps. It seems your warnings were not heeded, 'heroes' of Baldur's Gate.
206.context: NodeContext: Scorn for Sarevok, pushing back on the notion that he's won by influence the player. Gesturing at the sad and dark surrounds on last line.

237.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
237.text: I must admit it brings me pleasure to baptise an Unholy Assassin in your presence, noble heroes.
237.context: NodeContext: Scorn for Sarevok, pushing back on the notion that he's won by influence the player. Gesturing at the sad and dark surrounds on last line.

115.speaker: Jaheira
115.text: Do not presume any would follow your path, Sarevok. After all, you've shown them its sad and meaningless end.
115.context: NodeContext: Scorn for Sarevok, pushing back on the notion that he's won by influence the player. Gesturing at the sad and dark surrounds on last line.

36.speaker: Minsc
36.text: Our friend is not like you were, Sarevok. When Boo speaks to them of goodness, they does not get that stupid, soon-to-sneeze look on their face, as you used to.
36.context: NodeContext: Addressed to player, with fatherly tone, as one Bhaalist to another

21.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
21.text: A word of advice, Unholy Assassin - wrap your leash tighter about your slaves, lest their belligerence undoes you.
21.context: NodeContext: Addressed to player, with fatherly tone, as one Bhaalist to another

17.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
17.text: The reasons matter not. The celestial is dead. The offering is made.
17.context: NodeContext: authoritative, addressing the room at large

122.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
122.text: The discards of history may yet find their true purpose in Bhaal's service.

40.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
40.text: Take this amulet, child, and return it to your Father's chamber.

91.speaker: Jaheira
91.text: We act with a purpose, Sarevok. Perhaps you have forgotten what that feels like.

168.speaker: Minsc
168.text: Minsc does the doing, Boo the reasoning why - and he need not explain our noble cause to you, smooth-skull.

18.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
18.text: The Grand Harper - baptised in blood. What a sight to behold.
18.context: NodeContext: authoritative, addressing the room at large

258.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
258.text: The hamstered fool - once more stumbling across Bhaal's bloody path.
258.context: NodeContext: authoritative, addressing the room at large

232.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
232.text: You always were vulnerable to a grand narrative. Such weakness is common among heroes of your ilk.
232.context: NodeContext: authoritative, addressing the room at large

285.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
285.text: It matters not. The celestial is dead. The offering is made.
285.context: NodeContext: authoritative, addressing the room at large

136.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
136.text: Ah, faces I have not beheld for a long time. Nature's warrior and the idiot ranger.
136.context: NodeContext: Saying 'irony' like 'iron' - distaste and anger at seeing Sarevok again

2.speaker: Minsc
2.text: Minsc knows little of irony, but he would be happy to show you his steel again, Sarevok.
2.context: NodeContext: Saying 'irony' like 'iron' - distaste and anger at seeing Sarevok again

245.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
245.text: Child of Bhaal: do you not fear our Father's wrath? Why waste your time on discarded relics? With Bhaal's blood in your veins, you need them not.

185.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
185.text: Tell me, Unholy Assassin. Why waste your time on discarded relics? With Bhaal's favour you need them not.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: They know I am more than my lineage. You do not.

68.speaker: Jaheira
68.text: But do not let us keep you from your business. There is so very much sitting and sulking in the darkness to be done.

71.speaker: Minsc
71.text: Boo will leave your innards unfeasted on for now, Sarevok, but only to leave room for the villains who actually matter.
71.context: NodeContext: Scorn and distaste. As harsh a burn as Minsc can levy

280.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
280.text: Your wits remain as sharp as ever. But your devotion must be sharper still - for you now carry the Murder Lord's blessing, Unholy Assassin, and his expectation.

5.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
5.text: And you will be well-instructed. For you follow a Bhaalspawn.

93.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
93.text: I bestow upon you the Amulet of Bhaal - the vestment of his most unholy servants.

48.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
48.text: With this amulet, He grants you entry to His chambers - the undercity Temple of Bhaal.

210.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
210.text: The portfolio of murder passes into your hands. Do it justice. Enact slaughter befitting a god.

212.speaker: Player
212.text: Courting Bhaal's favour is but a means to an end. I am no acolyte of murder.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: They are powerful allies - I need all the help I can get.

273.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
273.text: Yet you still came here - seeking Lord Bhaal's favour.

27.speaker: Jaheira
27.text: Sarevok, Bhaal's least favourite son. Still tied to daddy's apron-strings?
27.context: NodeContext: Jeering - she's meeting an old enemy from the previous games

135.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
135.text: Behold, Father. Baptised in your most wretched name: a new Unholy Assassin.
135.context: CinematicNodeContext: We see the player walk into the pool of blood, submerging themselves

145.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
145.text: Do not test the Murder Lord's patience. Bathe now in the font of blood, and be baptised as His Unholy Assassin.
145.context: InternalNodeContext: Hasmet for the case where player had already killed Valeria prior to entering the Murder Tribunal (so didn't make the sacrifice in this scene.)

146.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
146.text: Today we witness near-perfection, Bhaalspawn. Your blood was foul before, but now you are twice-tarnished - the Unholiest Assassin.
146.context: NodeContext: impressed when any normal person would be disgusted/upset

130.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
130.text: Father shall be proud, indeed. Go to him, and present your sister as an offering. There isn't a moment to lose.

217.speaker: Player
217.text: I fell from my position at Bhaal's helm - why am I still worthy to become Chosen?

0.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
0.text: I remember the first time you set foot in the Tribunal. Fallen paladin, coated in the blood of your order. Pure corruption, I knew you would go far.

102.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
102.text: You don't recall all the wrong you wrought at the Temple, champion of the underworld. But one matter is undeniable:

254.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
254.text: You belong to Bhaal. He manifests within you. And you are a truer vessel of his cruelty than even the Slayer could be.

117.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
117.text: The thwarted dream of two centuries ago - for Father to walk the planes again - you are the one that can revive that dream.

35.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
35.text: While Bhaal receives tribute through Orin, He lives again through you.

191.speaker: Player
191.text: I shall be his very body on this world.

174.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
174.text: Go now, and do what I could not. Go to the heart of slaughter, and be the last to live.

112.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
112.text: The temple is beneath the city, where all blood spilled is drained.

162.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
162.text: Take this amulet, child, and return it to your Father's chamber. You are the true inheritor of his will, and he would smile to see you wear it.

161.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
161.text: Cleanse the temple of Orin's girlish shrines and bring your primal slaughter back to Bhaal.

25.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
25.text: There is nothing more I can teach you, but if you bring about her death, return to me. We shall revel in the divine memory together, as Family.

196.speaker: Player
196.text: Tribute is not enough for our Lord. She dies.

154.speaker: Player
154.text: I wish he trusted me to act on my own, without forcing my hand.

228.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
228.text: Does your body force you to blink? To breathe? To piss?

223.speaker: Player
223.text: I fear very greatly when he possesses me.

70.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
70.text: For you, His perfect creation, it is only natural.

66.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
66.text: Killing is but another vital function of your existence. Such is the Urge.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: I'm surprised you would have me as Chosen, over your own granddaughter.

213.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
213.text: Do not mistake my blessing. If it is your death that becomes the offering, I would worship that tragedy.

193.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
193.text: Father loves no sport more than the spillages of fratricide.

227.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
227.text: Every Bhaalspawn, other than he who would be Chosen, is born to die.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Join me. We shred her together.

141.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
141.text: The victorious Chosen must emerge from his own knife-arm. Far be it from me to bend Bhaal's will.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: I played your game, but I will go no further.

60.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
60.text: Perhaps your heart has spent too long bleeding. Bhaal will not allow for a moment of weakness.

230.speaker: Player
230.text: Very well. But first, I will slaughter you.

24.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
24.text: And so I am exposed to the instincts of a pure Bhaalspawn. I should have known. Yours is a nature not to be contained.

101.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
101.text: A true pleasure this will be, Bhaalspawn. Whether to kill you or to be killed by you.

147.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
147.text: Come, child of Bhaal. You have wrought exquisite murder. Enter now the font of blood and be purified in sin.
147.context: NodeContext: impressed when any normal person would be disgusted/upset

156.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
156.text: You return, Unholy Assassin, soaked with the stench of one familiar to me...
156.context: NodeContext: impressed when any normal person would be disgusted/upset

133.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
133.text: You have slain my granddaughter, Orin.
133.context: NodeContext: impressed when any normal person would be disgusted/upset

151.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
151.text: Your talents have outstripped my expectations.
151.context: NodeContext: impressed when any normal person would be disgusted/upset

171.speaker: Player
171.text: You ordered her own mother to kill her. I simply finished the job.
171.context: NodeContext: pause before he says this with a sickly smile

108.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
108.text: Poor child, she doted on her grandfather, the only person who tried to protect her when her mother failed to kill her.
108.context: NodeContext: pause before he says this with a sickly smile

248.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
248.text: I loved her as I loved her mother. One born from the other, both heritors of my essence.
248.context: NodeContext: pause before he says this with a sickly smile

83.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
83.text: Bhaal never had a more fecund offering than I sowed on his behalf.
83.context: NodeContext: pause before he says this with a sickly smile

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Why did you order Orin's mother to kill her?
53.context: NodeContext: pause before he says this with a sickly smile

65.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
65.text: What better offering to make to our Lord?

107.speaker: Player
107.text: Why would you make a child with your own child?
107.context: NodeContext: pause before he says this with a sickly smile

225.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
225.text: Bhaal's seed must be sown throughout the land that He might wreak murder on the world entire.

111.speaker: Player
111.context: NodeContext: pause before he says this with a sickly smile

46.speaker: Player
46.text: No more, Sarevok. It's time someone put an end to you.
46.context: NodeContext: pause before he says this with a sickly smile

164.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
164.text: I should raise a hymnal in your name, child. For the service you have done for me.
164.context: NodeContext: pause before he says this with a sickly smile

240.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
240.text: By spilling Orin's blood, you rouse an old man's withered passions from their slumber, and clear the way for their awakening.

23.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
23.text: I will rise again, the Dread Lord's Chosen once again. And you will be my offering.

207.speaker: Player
207.text: I told Orin the truth about you - that you ordered her own mother to kill her.

282.speaker: Player
282.text: I know the truth, Sarevok. Orin wasn't just your granddaughter. She was your daughter, too.

127.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
127.text: It is a shame you did not tell her. Orin never knew who her father was. Never knew how potent he could be.

255.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
255.text: She doted on her grandfather, the only person who tried to protect her when her mother failed to kill her.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: I told Orin your secret, Sarevok. That she was both your granddaughter and your daughter. She couldn't bear it.

63.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
63.text: I sowed the seeds of my intent. It was you that harvested them.

90.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
90.text: The child of Bhaal who slays the Chosen may himself become Bhaal's Chosen.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Aren't you sad I killed your granddaughter?

81.speaker: Player
81.text: Bow before me, Sarevok. I have accomplished more than you ever dreamed of.

246.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
246.text: You have slaughtered Bhaal's Chosen, yes. But I will not bow to you.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: Now you may experience my talents firsthand. I am here to kill you.

204.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
204.text: Go now child. Slaughter your sister, Orin. Take your rightful place as Father's heir.

214.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
214.text: The noble Jaheira - once more walking in Bhaal's bloody footsteps.

281.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
281.text: You return, taint-blessed kin-killer, having committed the holiest of sins.

149.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
149.text: Your despicable sister lies dead, and your Chosen body bathed in her blood.

257.speaker: Player
257.text: She withered when I told her your truth - that she was to be her mother's sacrifice.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: I discovered she was the sire of your own incest. Now your line is ended.

125.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
125.text: As my daughter raised our daughter, we debated to no end as to how we would make of her the perfect offering to the Dread Lord.

203.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
203.text: To eat her when she was but a babe? To drain a gallon of her blood each morn and pour it over his icon each night? To skin her, and craft the hide into a hilt for a sacred knife?

109.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
109.text: I am pleased she died a finer offering yet: there is no deeper honour than death in a duel with Bhaal's Chosen.

50.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
50.text: You have given me everything a father could hope for.

287.speaker: Player
287.text: Pah. All this birth is a distraction. The world over will be dead soon enough.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Even by Bhaal's standards, you're truly vile, uncle.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: The family tree is a bit of a circle, isn't it?

94.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
94.text: You failed to bring forth issue while you helmed our cult. It is a mortal sin for a Chosen.

220.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
220.text: I even hoped you and my daughter might one day create a new blood-lamb for us, but it is not to be...

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Bhaal below, I really just want to kill you.

183.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
183.text: And, would you know it, little Slayer, so do I you.

221.speaker: Player
221.text: Genuflect before my divine body, for I am Bhaal's new Chosen.

179.speaker: Player
179.text: I did. And now I'm here to bathe this place in yours.

173.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
173.text: Bhaal's will is absolute. The strongest of his bloodline will be Chosen. A spawn who kills a Chosen must then become Chosen themselves.

159.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
159.text: You have done me a great service, Child of Murder. In eliminating Orin, you have cleared the way for me.

88.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
88.text: With your death, will I prove myself anew. It is Father's way.

163.speaker: Player
163.text: Come on, I did the work of killing her. I'm the one worth his respect.

143.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
143.text: And who counselled you to do it?

182.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
182.text: Who laid a trap for the hot-blooded young Bhaalspawn, and tricked them to return?

59.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
59.text: I knew the old way. Two feral Bhaalpups, jostling for position at the top. One was going to die by the other's hand.

129.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
129.text: Thus, one would halve the work, of murdering to the top. They would never consider that another remained yet with a claim upon their title. You didn't even think of it when we spoke earlier.

202.speaker: Player
202.text: You don't have a hope in the Hells of defeating me.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: That's pure delusion. Bhaal would never anoint you as the Chosen, worm.

144.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
144.text: Perhaps not, but for his honour, I must try. To die by the hand of a Chosen is the only death I could ever wish to take.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: What a treat. Just like your granddaughter was, gargling on her own blood.

215.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
215.text: My aching bones in this husk still feel every spark of pain from the crystalline moment of my first death, in the Temple.

269.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
269.text: Let us die, Chosen, as only Bhaalspawn can.

274.speaker: Player
274.text: To arms, then. In Bhaal's name.

20.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
20.text: To receive the Blessing of Bhaal... I lie awake each night, in this sleepless scab of a form... dreaming of what it would have been like.

181.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
181.text: It must have been. And you have given me new hope yet.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: There is much left to do. This world must surrender to him.

140.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
140.text: You are so full of promise, the perfect Chosen. I almost hate to bring a challenge upon you.

275.speaker: Player
275.text: You will never know. You failed.

74.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
74.text: And every day living with the failure of my first death, I wondered... whether Bhaal might forgive me.

155.speaker: Player
155.text: And yet you still live, Sarevok, after all these years.

198.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
198.text: I died, once. A death in the selfsame temple chamber where you slaughtered Orin.

194.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
194.text: A long while ago, my wretched sibling brought me back. The fairest of Bhaalspawn, soul-bound me to this husk.

189.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
189.text: Worship death though I do, I refused it. I roamed the Coast, gathering those who still held Bhaal in their black hearts.

199.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
199.text: The cult survived, festering beneath the city, with me as the Gate's everlasting poison.

216.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
216.text: With these killings, the glory of the Bhaalists has risen beyond what we dreamed possible during those dark days.

67.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
67.text: And now that you have returned, we will have a new age of slaughter in your name. For you have slain Orin in our Father's Temple.

226.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
226.text: And yet, as you came afore Bhaal, you spat upon the glory all of our brood dream of so deeply.

229.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
229.text: Leaving Father with no Chosen at all.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: You're disgusting, siring a child from your own daughter.

38.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
38.text: And in the end she died for nothing. By your hand. The whole debacle caused naught but Bhaal's ire.

195.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
195.text: I'd hoped she would die by the Chosen's hand. But there is no Chosen in this cruel world, and soon I shall be all that remains of his line.

137.speaker: Player
137.text: She gave up before she died, when she heard of her mother's hate.

259.speaker: Player
259.text: I'm no Bhaalspawn. Not any longer.

262.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
262.text: For two hundred years, I wallowed in my own failure to dominate this city.

176.speaker: Player
176.text: Two hundred years late, but your hold over the Gate ends today.

175.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
175.text: And I remember my battle for the city like it was yesterday...

56.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
56.text: I didn't deserve an eternity of rest, I deserved only this shackle, to live forever on the outskirts of my own dear cult, and mourn my own downfall.

124.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
124.text: After centuries of this rancid defeat, I rejoice. For today, I meet the true definition of failure.

167.speaker: Player
167.text: Bhaal's line should have ended with you, Sarevok - how is it that you still live?

10.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
10.text: But you have brought it crashing at our Father's feet. With Orin's death and your rejection of him, you leave him with no Chosen.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: I will be the last of my line.

148.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
148.text: I will be the last of our line. As long as one Bhaalspawn lives yet, there may be a Chosen.

233.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
233.text: Perhaps Father will take me back if I clean the world of his little embarrassment.
